snippet: The Pirates’ Andrew McCutchen is the first African-American player to win an M.V.P. award since 2007, and he has a chance to make an impact on the declining numbers of African-American players in baseball.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that Pittsburgh Pirates’ Andrew McCutchen is the first African-American player to win an MVP award since 2007, and he has a chance to make an impact on the declining numbers of African-American players in baseball.
lead_paragraph: The Pirates’ Andrew McCutchen is the first African-American player to win an M.V.P. award since 2007, and he has a chance to make an impact on the declining numbers of African-American players in baseball.

headline.main: A Most Valuable Player With an Invaluable Platform
headline.print_headline: A Most Valuable Player With an Invaluable Platform
